title: OCCPROPHET: PUSHING EFFICIENCY FRONTIER OF CAMERA-ONLY 4D OCCUPANCY FORECASTING WITH OBSERVER-FORECASTER-REFINER FRAMEWORK
author: Junliang Chen (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Huaiyuan Xu (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Yi Wang (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Lap-Pui Chau (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), ... , Junliang Chen (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University)
relevance_why: The occupancy forecasting methods presented could inform the spatial understanding needed for audio-visual applications in environments, potentially benefiting audio scene analysis.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of predicting future occupancy in 3D driving environments using only camera input, which is crucial for autonomous vehicle safety.
contribution: OccProphet introduces a lightweight Observer-Forecaster-Refiner framework to efficiently forecast future occupancy states from camera inputs, achieving a significant reduction in computational costs with improved accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous occupancy forecasting methods, such as Cam4DOcc, relied heavily on LiDAR data and were computationally demanding.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work reduces computational costs by 58%-78% while improving forecasting accuracy by 4%-18% through innovative feature aggregation and attention mechanisms.

key_innovation: The framework's unique Observer module employs efficient 4D aggregation and tripling-attention mechanisms, allowing for real-time processing of occupancy data.
real_world_impact: The efficiency of OccProphet makes it viable for deployment in autonomous vehicles, potentially improving safety and responsiveness in complex environments.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned in the paper.

new_terms.Observer-Forecaster-Refiner framework: **Observer-Forecaster-Refiner framework** is a novel structure proposed for occupancy forecasting that enhances the prediction process through separate yet integrated modules.
new_terms.4D Aggregation: **4D Aggregation** refers to the process of combining spatial and temporal data into a unified format for improved analysis of dynamic environments.

open_sourcing: Code and models are publicly available at https://github.com/JLChen-C/OccProphet
